Authors: Alexandra J., Fadhly M., Wang G., Sfenrianto
Title: A blockchain system for digital payment transaction
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Trends in Computer Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Alexandra, J., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Fadhly, M., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wang, G., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sfenrianto, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program – Information System Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: In this modern times, there are various options for conducting financial transaction or payment. This is related to the rapid development of technology that can make payment transaction more easily and practically. The entry of technology can not be denied to affect all various aspects of human life, including in the case of buying and selling or the use of cash to the bill payment process. If we can see, In Indonesia many digital based financial services are present, such as e-wallet like Sakuku, LinkAja, Go-Pay, OVO, Jenius, Dana, etc. With this service, people can make payment transaction for various purposes with the existing balance in e-wallet. The use of e-wallet is considered more convenient and profitable. It is considered to be more convenient because it is sufficient to carry out all transaction only from mobile phone. It's profitable because usually you will be offered lots of discounts and cashback from merchants who work with e-wallet providers. According to survey conducted by Databooks.co.id, this is the most 10 frequently used e-wallet in Indonesia 2020. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.

Authors: Alexandra J., Maria E., Oktavia T.
Title: Enrichment Program System to Enhance Student's Working Experience (Study Case: XYZ University)
Source title: Proceeding - 2019 International Conference on ICT for Smart Society: Innovation and Transformation Toward Smart Region, ICISS 2019
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Study School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Alexandra, J., Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Study School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Maria, E., Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Study School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Oktavia, T., Bina Nusantara University, Information Systems Study School of Information Systems, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Currently educational institution is challenged to provide graduates to be ready to work in working environment. To accommodate this requirement many higher education's institutions try to create new initiatives to enrich the graduate's competency of students with working experience so it can reduce the gap competency that industry faced when they recruit fresh graduate. One of the solutions proposed by XYZ university for higher education institution is to create enrichment program. The enrichment program is a program to increase student experience in real world work environment. In this program, the students will involve in working environment to learn how to be the worker in company and they will do all responsibility as an employee. To facilitate the enrichment program can running well, this study will propose the systems to accommodate enrichment program operation. Therefore, the design of this system aims to identify, analyze needs, and design a website-based application that is integrated with learning management systems so it can be used easily by parties involved in the enrichment processes, such as student, study program departments, enrichment program division, and company as an enrichment partner. This application is designed using System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) method which refers to architecture design, interface design, and database design. The result of this study is the model of enrichment systems that can facilitate the daily operation of enrichment program to accommodate the requirement of each party (student, study program, enrichment division, and company as partner). © 2019 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Application programs; Blast enrichment; Education computing; Employment; Life cycle; Models; Architecture designs; competency; Educational institutions; graduate; Higher education institutions; Learning management system; SDLC; System development life cycles; Students
